name: China and the World
description: A study of the history of China's relationship with the rest of the world in the modern era. The readings focus on China's role in the global economy, politics, religious movements, transnational diasporas, scientific/technological exchanges, and cultural encounters and conflicts in the ages of empire and globalization.  Same as GASC57H3Africa and Asia Area
prerequisites: Any 4.0 credits, including 0.5 credit at the A- or B-level in HIS courses
